comments.content: Why D is correct ??? , it supposes to be A. I tried it no error message appear
Sorry I mean it supposes B is the correct Answer, not A.

choices.D: It executes successfully and displays the list of faculty names followed by a "no data found" error message.
choices.A: It goes into an infinite loop.
choices.C: It does not execute and displays an error message because the end-of-file condition is not taken care of.
choices.B: It executes successfully and displays only the list of faculty names.

questions.question_text:
/temp/my_files is an existing folder in the server, facultylist.txt is an existing text file in this folder.
Examine the following commands that are executed by the DBA:
SQL>CREATE DIRECTION my_dir AS /temp/my_files:
SQL>GRANT READ ON DIRECTORY my_dir To public:
View the Exhibit and examine the procedure created by user SCOTT to read the list of faculty names from the text file.
//IMG//

SCOTT executes the procedure as follows:

SQL>SET SERVEROUTPUT ON -
SQL>EXEC read_file (MY_DIR, FACULTYLIST.TXT)
What is the outcome?

Examine the following command:

SQL>ALTER SESSION -
SET plsql_warnings *
'enable: severe',
'enable: performance',
'ERROR: 05003';
What is the implication of the above command?

discussion.content: I think answer B is wrong because there is no ERROR.05003 warning, it is 05003. my answer is C.
I think it should be BC due to 'enable: severe'

choices.D: It causes the compilation to fail whenever the code gives wrong results or contains statements that are never executed.
choices.A: It issues a warning whenever ERROR: 05003 occur during compilation.
choices.B: It causes the compilation to fail whenever the warning ERROR.05003 occurs.
choices.C: It issues warnings whenever the code causes an unexpected action or wrong results performance problems.

discussion.content: Itâ€™s an Associative Array and key are stored to its indexing definition.

comments.content: not because A not specify the order of storage

choices.A: It executes successfully and gives the desired output.
choices.D: It does not execute because the value that is once assigned to the element of the associative array cannot be changed.
choices.B: It does not execute because the definition of type population is indexed by VARCHAR2.
choices.C: It executes, and the string keys of an associative array are not stored in creation order, but in sorted order.

questions.question_text:
User SCOTT has been granted CREATE ANY TRIGGER AND ALTER ANY TABLE by the DBA. HR is an existing schema in the database.
SCOTT creates the following trigger:
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER drop_trigger

BEFORE DROP ON hr.SCHEMA -

BEGIN -
RAISE_APPLICATION_ERROR (-20000, Cannot drop object');
END:
SCOTT does not grant the execute privilege on this trigger to any other users.
For which user(s) would this trigger fire by default when they drop an object in the hr schema?

discussion.content: option A is correct. i have tchecked here.

A SCHEMA trigger is created on a schema and fires whenever the user who owns it is the current user and initiates the triggering event:
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/appdev.112/e25519/triggers.htm#LNPLS99886

Why doesn't it work for sys?
Also I thought you can't grant privileges on triggers...
I dont understand why is not D, the trigger should fires every time a user has rights to use drop statement on hr.schema ....

comments.content: scott cannot drop tables in hr schema

discussion.content: Yes, B,E is the correct answer.
D is not correct because the CONTINUE statement force you to go to the next iteration without checking if exits or no other statement after the CONTINUE statement.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the continue statement? (Choose two.)

choices.D: The statements after the continue statement in the iteration are executed before terminating the LOOP.
choices.C: The loop completes immediately and control passes to the statement after end loop.
choices.E: The current iteration of the loop completes immediately and control passes to the next iteration of the loop.
choices.A: The PL/SQL block execution terminates immediately.
choices.B: The CONTINUE statement cannot appear outside a loop.
